sub_title: Early Stage Researcher / Doctoral student at Eindhoven University of Technology
summary:
My university’s motto is “Improve your world”. We students have decided to adopt this maxim to improve our lives by standing up for the environment and its inhabitants. My personal way of doing such is through polymers and chemistry! 

I am a motivated international student (US/Italian citizen) from Florence, Italy, and an aspiring polymer technology scientist currently conducting my PhD studies at Eindhoven University of Technology under the supervision of Prof. Jan van Hest. My area of interest is developing sustainable and biomedical materials using biotechnology and polymer chemistry; in the future, I plan to pursue employment in the research & development world. To move my aspirations forward, I have participated in an MSc program specifically specialized in the study of biomaterials, sustainable and natural polymers, and in the interface between polymer and biological science. 

Seeking opportunities to help improve the world we live in and contribute to reducing the ever-growing problems associated with plastics.

school.name: State University of New York College of Environmental Science and Forestry

profile_positions.description:
Marie Sklodowska-Curie fellow - Early Stage Researcher on the development of nanomotors for directional artificial cell motion.

Supervising professor - Prof. Jan Cornelis Maria van Hest
profile_positions.title: Early Stage Researcher / Doctoral student

profile_positions.description:
•Served as Teaching Assistant in “General Chemistry” and led weekly guided study and tutorial sessions (2x/week).
•Assisted in the preparation and presentation of teaching material, exercises, and supported students in guided problem resolution in general chemistry principles, scientific conventions, and basic reaction schemes for small molecule synthesis.
•Answered specific study questions, graded student assignments/exam, and consulted with students over grading when they inquired.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant in “Introduction chemistry & chemical technology” (course code: 6A2X0 - 2022-1)

profile_positions.description:
- Conducted weekly (2x/week) study sessions and tutorials in Organic Chemistry for BSc students.
- Supported students through guided problem resolution about synthetic pathways, small molecule development and characterisation, and underlying general physical principles that guide reactions.
•Answered specific study questions, graded student assignments/exam, and consulted with students over grading when they inquired.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant for “Organic Chemistry course for Chemistry Bachelors” (course code: 6M1X0)

profile_positions.description:
Primary Investigator: Mauri Kostiainen, PhD
Supervisor: Kalle Lintinen, PhD

MSc thesis within the Biohybrid Materials Research Group

Project: Synthetic functionalization of lignin nanospheres for advanced materials applications
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Primary Investigator: Craig J. Hawker, PhD
Supervisor: Caitlin Sample

•Participated in an NSF-funded research internship program focused on dynamically bonded materials at the Materials Research Laboratory, UCSB. 

Project: Dynamically Bonded Materials

Overview
A National Science Foundation and Material Research Laboratory-funded science and engineering Internships program that partners University of California, Santa Barbara, with international research institutions to provide exchange 10-week summer research experiences.
profile_positions.title: CISEI Research Intern

profile_positions.company: State University of New York College of Environmental Science and Forestry
profile_positions.description:
Primary Investigator: Christopher Nomura, PhD
Supervisor: Ryan Scheel
•Focused on investigating the synthesis and properties of eco-friendly, bio-based materials, in particular, the synthesis and production of polyhydroxyalkanoate (PHA) biodegradable polymers and the subsequent characterization of such polymers
•Conducted general laboratory procedures such as gel preparation, DNA extraction, autoclave materials, Soxhlet Extractions, Microbial cultivation, Purifications, and NMR.
•Prepared and cleaned of lab and instruments, assisted supervisors in the execution of experiments and upkeep of laboratory equipment, and completed other tasks as needed.

Honors Thesis: Pulp product waste use as novel feedstock for increased production of Poly(hydroxybutyrate) (PHB) through bacterial fermentation
•Focused on improving the production of poly(hydroxybutyrate) through novel feedstocks and genetic engineering
•Transformed bacteria and conducted growth experiments to produce valuable polymer products
•Extracted, purified, and quantified PHB through methanolysis, filtering, and Gas Chromatography
Presented Scientific findings via a poster presentation at ESF’s Student Spotlight on Research Symposium and via laboratory report as an Honors thesis
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Primary Investigator: Dacheng Ren, PhD
Supervisor: Sang Won Lee

•Participated in an NSF-funded research internship program focused on biomaterials-related studies at the Syracuse Biomaterials Institute 

Project: Investigation of E. coli RP437/pGLO biofilm on nano-scale dynamic surface topography

•Performed original research concerning the antifouling activity of dynamic surface topography on wild-type strains of E. coli and subsequent biofilm detachment
•Conducted visualization of bacterial growth through Fluorescence Microscopy and captured layered z-stack images of biomass growth in order to create 3-D imaging of it
•Presented scientific findings via poster presentation and laboratory report at the Syracuse University Summer Research Symposium

Overview:
A National Science Foundation-funded science and engineering Internships program that provide exchange summer research experiences focused on biomaterials.
